courseDescription:
Since its inception, computer-aided design (CAD) has grown in popularity and relevance due to its widespread adoption by top manufacturing industries such as civil engineering to design and execute projects. This course has been created to teach you the features and applications of various software used in CAD. It begins with an overview of the history and significance of CAD, as well as the skills, requirements, and roles of a CAD designer. Learn about product design, cost estimations, and considerations for using CAD, as well as solid and fluid mechanisms terms and laws.

The idea behind 3D drawings is to add a third dimension to designs to show depth all in one view. By taking this course, you will also learn about 2D drawings, the Z coordinate, geometry, and modeling in CAD. Discover the concepts of assemblies and mechatronic simulations in CAD, as well as extrusion and rotation. We will teach you about grids, regular polygons, and blending operations in CAD. Learn the properties of various parameters in civil drawings such as walls and columns, and then the features and applications of AutoCAD, T-FLEX, FreeCAD, and SolidWorks in computer-aided design.

The value of CAD cannot be overstated, from preliminary design and layouts to design details, calculations, and 3D modeling. The demand for these jobs will only increase as technology advances. This course was created to serve as a free online guide for anyone interested in becoming a CAD designer. Upskill by enrolling today!
